questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an operating system?
questions.answer: Manage hardware resources

questions.question: What is the kernel in an operating system?
options: The core part of the operating system that provides essential services
questions.answer: The core part of the operating system that provides essential services

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm is based on priority levels assigned to tasks?
questions.answer: Priority Scheduling

questions.question: What is virtual memory in the context of operating systems?
options: A memory management technique that provides an 'illusion' of larger memory
A memory management technique that provides an (illusion) of larger memory
questions.answer: A memory management technique that provides an 'illusion' of larger memory

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'grep' command in Unix/Linux?
options: Search for a pattern in files
questions.answer: Search for a pattern in files

questions.question: What does the acronym RAID stand for in the context of disk storage?
questions.answer: Redundant Array of Independent Disks

questions.question: In the context of file systems, what is a 'inode'?
options: A record containing information about a file or directory
questions.answer: A record containing information about a file or directory

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'chmod' command in Unix/Linux?
questions.answer: Change file permissions

questions.question: Which file system is commonly used in Unix/Linux operating systems?
questions.answer: Ext4

questions.question: What is the role of the 'swap space' in virtual memory management?
options: Extend the RAM capacity by using the hard disk
questions.answer: Extend the RAM capacity by using the hard disk

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'ping' command in networking?
options: Check the connectivity to a remote host
questions.answer: Check the connectivity to a remote host

questions.question: What is a 'fork bomb' in the context of operating systems?
options: A denial-of-service attack that creates a large number of processes
questions.answer: A denial-of-service attack that creates a large number of processes

questions.question: Which process scheduling algorithm gives each process a fixed time slot?
questions.answer: Round Robin

questions.question: What is a 'shell' in the context of operating systems?
options: A protective layer for the hardware
A user interface for accessing operating system services
questions.answer: A user interface for accessing operating system services

questions.question: Which operating system is known for its open-source nature and use of the Linux kernel?
questions.answer: Linux

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'fdisk' command in Unix/Linux?
questions.answer: Partition a disk

questions.question: In the context of process synchronization, what is a 'mutex'?
options: A synchronization primitive to control access to shared resources
questions.answer: A synchronization primitive to control access to shared resources

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'grep' command in Unix/Linux?
options: Search for a pattern in files
questions.answer: Search for a pattern in files

questions.question: What is a 'context switch' in the context of operating systems?
options: A process of changing from one task to another
questions.answer: A process of changing from one task to another

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'kill' command in Unix/Linux?
questions.answer: Terminate a process
